page.title: 02DUFTON STATISTICS
page.content: There are 85 dwellings in Dufton parish,14 are farms,14 holiday homes and 5 are empty awaiting sale or reoccupation.There is a church, chapel,village hall and barite mining plant. The population is 160 including 24 children from 16 homes who attend Long Marton and Appleby schools.Only one is under school age. 77 workers come from 44 households, 25 are employed on farms, 14 within the village and the remainder travel outside.But there is no public transport.There are 59 others in the parish. 22 homes have no wage earner,mainly due to the age of occupants. Dufton has a shop/Post Office,pub,YHA hostel and some bed and breakfast and catering facilities.There are 2 small camping sites.
